thread.title: Chinese President watches youth team at training facility
thread.title_full: Chinese President watches youth team at training facility

title: Chinese President watches youth team at training facility
text:
Chinese President watches youth team at training facility 
CCTV.com Full coverage: President Xi Visits UK Chinese President Xi Jinping (2nd L), accompanied by British Prime Minister David Cameron (2nd R), visits the City Football Academy in Manchester, Britain, Oct. 23, 2015. 
The President is now back in China, but during his stay in the UK, he had the opportunity to tour Manchester City's training facility. And he was accompanied by British Prime Minister David Cameron at the football ground.President Xi, a football fan who has previously stated that one of his dreams is for the Chinese national team to someday win a World Cup, was shown around Man City's football academy by chairman Khaldoon Al Mubarak.Xi Jinping and Cameron stood next to a replica of the Jules Rimet Trophy, lifted by England football captain Bobby Moore in 1966 after winning the World Cup, and saw other memorabilia from Britain's National Football Museum.The President and Prime Minister were also greeted by former Manchester United defender Gary Neville.President Xi and Prime Minister Cameron also took the opportunity to meet Man City striker Sergio Aguero and women's team player Toni Duggan, and to watch a training session with one of the club's youth teams. Former star Patrick Vieira helped show off the side's state-of-the-art complex. Related Videos
